identified-content.person: Fienning, to First Lt. Edward Baldwin

block.p: Mary Alice Krause, a daughter of Alice and Peter C. Krause of New York, was married yesterday to First Lt. Edward Baldwin Fienning, a son of Suzanne and Charles E. Fienning of Sumter, S.C. The Rev. Edward W. Fitzgerald officiated at St. Mary of the Annunciation Roman Catholic Church in Charleston, S.C.
The bride, 27, and the bridegroom, 28, met at Harvard, from which they graduated.

Mary Alice Krause, a daughter of Alice and Peter C. Krause of New York, was married yesterday to First Lt. Edward Baldwin Fienning, a son of Suzanne and Charles E. Fienning of Sumter, S.C. The Rev. Edward W. Fitzgerald officiated at St. Mary of the Annunciation Roman Catholic Church in Charleston, S.C.

Mary Alice Krause, a daughter of Alice and Peter C. Krause of New York, was married yesterday to First Lt. Edward Baldwin Fienning, a son of Suzanne and Charles E. Fienning of Sumter, S.C. The Rev. Edward W. Fitzgerald officiated at St. Mary of the Annunciation Roman Catholic Church in Charleston, S.C.
The bride, 27, and the bridegroom, 28, met at Harvard, from which they graduated.
Mrs. Fienning, who is known as Molly, in August is to become a commercial agent at Lowcountry Real Estate in Beaufort, S.C.

Her father is a managing director at Greenhill & Company, an investment banking concern in New York, and is the chairman of the Barrow Street Real Estate Funds. Her mother writes a blog, newsonwomen.com, about women's achievements in business, science and technology, education and the arts.

Lieutenant Fienning is a Marine fighter pilot at the Oceana Naval Air Station in Virginia Beach with the VFA-106 squadron, a joint Navy and Marine F/A-18 unit that trains new pilots. Next month he is to be stationed at the air station in Beaufort.
His mother is a wedding coordinator in Sumter and his father is the president of Sumter Packaging Corporation, which makes corrugated boxes.
